title: How to get a a peak count matrix with ArchR?
body: Hi, I got the peak matrix  with getMatrixFromProject() in ArchR, but  I looked up the code and it seems that  this peak matrix is not normalized. Can this peak count matrix be used in SCRIP enrich function?

title: Input to impute function
body:
Hello @xindong95 , I'm interested in using SCRIP software to identify gene targets of some transcription factors that apparently have an important activity on my samples. I processed my scATAC-seq data with Signac pipeline, so I exported peaks by cell-matrix from a Signac object and then I covert it to .h5 format. I planned to use _impute_ function to later use the function _target_ but when I use this code
`SCRIP impute -i $input_path/peaks_by_cell.h5 -s hs -f mtx -p Target_FLi1 --factor FLI1` 
I got the next error:

> Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vale/.local/bin/SCRIP", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/vale/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/SCRIP/start.py", line 39, in main
    run_impute(args)
  File "/home/vale/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/SCRIP/imputation/impute.py", line 187, in run_impute
    feature_matrix = sc.read_10x_h5(feature_matrix_path, gex_only=False)
  File "/home/vale/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/scanpy/readwrite.py", line 195, in read_10x_h5
    adata = _read_legacy_10x_h5(filename, genome=genome, start=start)
  File "/home/vale/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/scanpy/readwrite.py", line 221, in _read_legacy_10x_h5
    _collect_datasets(dsets, f[genome])
  File "/home/vale/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/scanpy/readwrite.py", line 253, in _collect_datasets
    for k, v in group.items():
AttributeError: 'Dataset' object has no attribute 'items'

I don't understand if the error is because  the input file isn't correct or something else. Its possible to use another format as an input file for this function?

title: Where is PBMC_granulocyte_sorted_10k_peak_count.h5 ?
body:
Hi, could you tell me where I can download the ATAC PMBC peak count file ? 

I followed your documentation in https://scrip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples/PBMC.html and https://github.com/xindong95/SCRIP_notebook/blob/main/PBMC_python.ipynb

Your tutorial said: `atac_adata = sc.read_10x_h5('example/PBMC/data/PBMC_granulocyte_sorted_10k_peak_count.h5', gex_only=False)`

But I cannot find `PBMC_granulocyte_sorted_10k_peak_count.h5` from 10X website https://www.10xgenomics.com/resources/datasets/pbmc-from-a-healthy-donor-granulocytes-removed-through-cell-sorting-10-k-1-standard-2-0-0

title: Is there any edge weight in the output GRN?
body:
Hello.

My current goal is to build a directed edge-weighted GRN using only scATAC-seq data, and I feel like SCRIP can help me achieve this goal. I'm not sure so I came to ask you

Looking forward to your reply
